critique: This executive order establishes a commission and initiative to improve the quality of life for Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders through increased participation in Federal programs. It focuses on data collection, research, and coordination of federal efforts. There is an emphasis on diversity and inclusion. It does not seem to expand executive power significantly, but rather directs existing departments to focus on a specific population. It does not directly address immigration. It could be seen as slightly liberal due to its focus on social inclusion and government intervention to address disparities. It centralizes some authority within the Department of Health and Human Services. It does not obviously impact national security or civil liberties. It involves government intervention to address disparities, so it is not deregulation. It emphasizes diversity and inclusion.
